meanings.definition: Persuades or convinces someone to do something by gentle urging or flattery.
meanings.sent1: She coaxes her cat to come inside by calling its name softly.
meanings.sent2: He coaxes the shy student to join the group project with kind words.
meanings.sent3: The puppy coaxes the kitten to play by wagging its tail excitedly.
meanings.sent4: The sun coaxes the flowers to bloom with its warm rays.
meanings.sent5: The teacher coaxes the students to participate by praising their efforts.

meanings.definition: Uses gentle persuasion or flattery to obtain something.
meanings.sent1: The salesman coaxes the customer to buy the new product with a friendly smile.
meanings.sent2: She coaxes the secret recipe out of her grandmother with a hug.
meanings.sent3: The magician coaxes the rabbit out of the hat with a wave of his wand.
meanings.sent4: The wind coaxes the leaves to dance in the air with its gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: The child coaxes the toy from the vending machine with a few extra coins.

meanings.definition: Coaxes someone into doing something by being charming or persuasive.
meanings.sent1: He coaxes his friend into trying the new restaurant by describing the delicious food.
meanings.sent2: She coaxes her brother into sharing his toys by offering to play together.
meanings.sent3: The cat coaxes the dog into chasing its tail by pretending to be scared.
meanings.sent4: The music coaxes the audience into dancing with its lively beat.
meanings.sent5: The coach coaxes the team into victory with inspiring pep talks.
